alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 11:01AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Nevada, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 AM PDT, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding, especially near creeks and streams, including Martin Creek. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winnemucca, Orovada, Kings River Valley, Paradise Valley, Leonard Creek Ranch, McDermitt, Denio, Golconda, Dufferena, Valmy, Thacker Pass, Paradise Hill Summit, Winnemucca Airport, Denio Summit, Onion Reservoir, Adam Peak, Golconda Summit, Chimney Dam Reservoir, Summit Lake and Twin Creeks Mine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
